title: Christina Romer and John Brennan to deliver speeches in Washington, DC on Thursday morning | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House




August 05, 2009

 



Christina Romer and John Brennan to deliver speeches in Washington, DC on Thursday morning




 THE WHITE HOUSE Office of the Press Secretary  _______________________________________________________________________________  For Immediate Release                                                               August 5, 2009  MEDIA ADVISORY: Christina Romer and John Brennan   to deliver speeches in Washington, DC on Thursday morning  On Thursday, August 6th, Council of Economic Advisers Chair Christina Romer and Assistant to the President for Homeland Security and Counterterrorism John Brennan will deliver speeches in Washington, DC. At 8:00AM EDT, Romer will deliver remarks at the Economic Club of Washington, DC. Dr. Romer will assess the impact of the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act on the economy and what we can expect going forward. At 11:00AM EDT at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, Brennan will provide an overview of the President's comprehensive approach to protecting the American people from terrorism: defeating the near-term threat from al Qaeda and other transnational terrorist groups and addressing the political, economic, and social factors that often fuel violent extremism. Remarks by Christina Romer  WHERE: The Newseum, 555 Pennsylvania Avenue NW (7th floor) WHEN: 8:00AM EDT MEDIA LOGISTICS: The Economic Club of Washington, DC is handling all media logistics and credentialing. For information and credentials, please e-mail Judi Irastorza at media@economicclub.org.     Remarks by John Brennan  WHERE: Center for Strategic and International Studies, B1 Conference Center, 1800 K Street NW WHEN: 11:00AM EDT MEDIA LOGISITICS: The Center for Strategic and International Studies is handling all media logistics and credentialing. For information and credentials, please contact H. Andrew Schwartz at 202-775-3242 or externalrelations@CSIS.org.
